title: Commending Homecrest Community Services on its Annual Chinese New Year Banquet on March 4, 2011
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION commending Homecrest Community Services upon the
occasion of its Annual Chinese New Year Banquet and  celebration  of  14
years  of  service  to Brooklyn's Chinese American community on March 4,
2011

WHEREAS, It is the sense of  this  Legislative  Body  to  recognize  and
applaud  institutions  which faithfully serve the needs of the community
and its citizens with diligence and compassionate commitment to  improv-
ing the quality and dignity of life in the community; and
  WHEREAS,  Attendant to such concern and fully in accord with its long-
standing traditions, it is  the  intent  of  this  Legislative  Body  to
commend  Homecrest  Community Services, Inc. (HCS) for 14 years of exem-
plary service to Brooklyn's Chinese-American community upon the occasion
of its Annual Chinese New Year Banquet, to be held at Jing Fong  Restau-
rant on March 4, 2011, welcoming the Year of the Rabbit, 4709; and
  WHEREAS,  Homecrest  Community  Services  is a non-profit multi-social
service agency serving more than 3,000 senior citizens, immigrants,  and
families,  primarily from China and other southeast Asian countries, who
have relocated to southern Brooklyn in recent years; and
  WHEREAS, Congregate hot lunches, social adult daycare,  English  as  a
Second   Language   and   civics  classes,  benefit  assistance,  health
promotion, and educational and cultural services are provided  at  Home-
crest Community Services' Sheepshead Bay and Bensonhurst Senior Centers;
and
  WHEREAS,  Remaining  true to its mission, Homecrest Community Services
continues to work diligently to expand and improve its services  to  the
citizens  and  community it serves and merits the praise and recognition
of this Legislative Body; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
commend  Homecrest  Community  Services  upon the occasion of its Annual
Chinese New Year Banquet and celebration  of  14  years  of  service  to
Brooklyn's  Chinese-American  community  on  March  4,  2011;  and be it
further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Homecrest Community Services.
